description: Ovid was the most witty and popular Roman poet of his time, and his 12,000-line
Metamorphoseshas influenced more European literature and art than any other
classical Latin text.  By analyzing two modern English translations and studying other
poems, stories, and artwork based on the Metamorphoses, students gain an
understanding of the nature of Ovid's storytelling and the power that it has exerted on
our cultural tradition. Offered periodically during Interim. Counts toward ancient studies,
